total_gross_exposure.notes: Sum of all P50 (midpoint) values across all risk categories

total_probability_weighted.notes: Applies probability estimates to each exposure; P10/P50/P90 represent distribution of outcomes

correlation_adjusted.adjustment_rationale: Reduced for correlated exposures: Orange County SFF termination + WARN Act penalties (same root cause), FCA settlement + medical director kickback overlap

regulatory_penalties.notes: CMS DPNA losses, CMPs, Orange County SFF termination risk

litigation_settlement.notes: Martinez FCA settlement, CIA compliance costs, medical director kickback contribution

employment_labor.notes: WARN Act penalties, wage compliance, retention investment, California SB 525

commercial_operational.notes: Therapy contract assignment fees, medical director FMV violations, vendor assignment

uninsured_exposure.notes: D&O coverage gaps for FCA, WARN Act exclusion, DPNA/CMP exclusions

privacy_cyber.notes: Ransomware attack expected value (low probability, high impact)

tax_benefits_positive.notes: Section 338(h)(10) annual tax savings (reduces net exposure)

exposure_ranges.notes: P10/P50/P90 represent 10th, 50th, and 90th percentile outcomes based on range distributions

escrow_recommendation.release_schedule: 30% at 12 months, 40% at 18 months, 30% at 24 months

adequacy_flags: Escrow covers largest single risk (Orange County SFF termination $24.6M)
Coverage ratio 58% adequate for 18-24 month exposure window
CIA costs ($11M-$16M over 5 years) extend beyond escrow period - recommend R&W insurance

allocation.rationale: Settlement $8M-$15M expected Q1-Q2 2025; CIA Year 1-2 costs $4M-$6M; escrow covers initial settlement and 2-year CIA compliance
allocation.release_trigger: Settlement finalized and CIA Year 2 report submitted to OIG

allocation.rationale: March 2025 survey critical; if immediate jeopardy cited or full SFF designation, $24.6M annual revenue at risk; escrow covers 50% of exposure for 18-month mitigation period
allocation.release_trigger: Orange County exits SFF candidate status OR September 2025 survey shows sustained improvement

allocation.risk: WARN Act Penalties (if Orange County closes)
allocation.rationale: 290 employees × 60 days back pay = $3.75M-$4.5M if no notice; escrow covers 70% of exposure
allocation.release_trigger: Orange County continues operations 18 months post-closing OR proper 60-day WARN notice provided if closure

allocation.risk: Therapy Contract Assignment Fees + Transition Costs
allocation.rationale: 12-24 therapy contracts × $50K-$100K assignment fees = $600K-$2.4M; buffer for temporary agency staffing if terminations
allocation.release_trigger: All therapy consents obtained OR replacement providers secured with <10% cost premium

allocation.rationale: 144 CNAs below $21/hour minimum effective June 1, 2025; $1.2M annual cost + retroactive liability risk
allocation.release_trigger: California facilities compliant with SB 525 wages by June 1, 2025

purchase_price_adjustment.rationale: Immediate cash needs + uninsurable exposure + EBITDA impairments require price reduction beyond escrow holdback

components.rationale: Orange County $990K + Desert Sun $540K = $1.53M already lost pre-closing; reduce purchase price for trailing losses
Orange County $95K + Desert Sun $42K = $137K regulatory fines already paid; reduce EBITDA
D&O policy may exclude FCA settlement ($8M-$15M × 40-60% exclusion = $3.2M-$9M uninsured); price reduction reflects 50th percentile uninsured exposure
$11M annual wage/benefit increases less $3.5M recruitment savings/revenue = $7.5M net cost; purchase price reduced for buyer's required retention capex

purchase_price_adjustment.notes: Recommended net purchase price $410M ($425M - $15M adjustment); combined with $28M escrow, effective day-one price to seller is $382M

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Orange County SFF Termination Risk - March 2025 survey critical; 30-40% probability of full SFF designation or immediate jeopardy recurrence triggering provider agreement termination
top_10_risks_ranked.valuation_method: Face value - immediate revenue loss if termination
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Pre-survey mock survey, interim management team, staffing surge to 3.6 PPD, zero-tolerance quality assurance

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Martinez FCA Qui Tam Settlement - DOJ intervention expected Q1-Q2 2025; settlement for therapy upcoding, PDPM gaming, medical director kickbacks
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Tender to D&O insurer immediately, cooperate with DOJ, proactive disclosure of medical director FMV issues

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Corporate Integrity Agreement (5-Year Monitoring) - Independent Review Organization, annual reports, compliance training, arrangements review
top_10_risks_ranked.valuation_method: DCF at 8% discount rate over 5 years
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Negotiate 3-year term instead of 5-year, limit IRO scope to claims review only, integrate with existing compliance program

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Staff Retention Investment Required - 67% nursing turnover requires comprehensive wage increases, benefits enhancements, career development to stabilize workforce
top_10_risks_ranked.notes: Net cost $7.5M annually after $3.5M recruitment savings + occupancy revenue; required investment to maintain operations
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Implement immediately post-closing; ROI positive by Year 4 with quality improvement revenue gains

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: WARN Act Penalties - Orange County closure (if SFF termination) triggers 60-day notice requirement for 290 employees; failure = $3.75M-$4.5M penalties
top_10_risks_ranked.notes: Uninsured - EPLI excludes statutory penalties; correlates with Orange County SFF termination risk
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Provide 60-day notice in January 2028 if closure anticipated; eliminates penalty exposure entirely

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Medical Director FMV Violations - Dr. Johnson $180K compensation (90th percentile) with alleged minimal duties strengthens Martinez FCA kickback allegations
top_10_risks_ranked.valuation_method: Midpoint - contribution to FCA settlement if AKS violations proven
top_10_risks_ranked.notes: Overlaps with Martinez FCA settlement; counted separately here but correlation adjustment applied in aggregate
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Renegotiate to $150K-$165K (75th percentile), obtain third-party FMV opinion, document actual hours

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: D&O Coverage Gap for FCA Settlement - 40-60% probability D&O insurer excludes fraud-based claims; $4.8M-$10.5M uninsured exposure
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Tender claim immediately, negotiate with insurer for partial coverage, purchase tail policy if exclusion applies

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Future DPNA Risk - Orange County and other facilities at risk of repeat immediate jeopardy citations triggering new DPNA periods
top_10_risks_ranked.notes: Uninsured - professional liability excludes regulatory fines and lost revenue
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Maintain cash reserves $2M-$3M, implement quality improvement programs across all facilities

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Therapy Contract Assignment Fees + Transition Risk - 12-24 contracts requiring consent; 20-30% termination probability; temporary agency costs if terminations
top_10_risks_ranked.valuation_method: Expected value: $1.5M assignment fees + $1.75M transition risk
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Pre-closing consents with Silver Oak financials, negotiate fee waivers with contract extensions, identify backup providers

top_10_risks_ranked.finding: Ransomware Attack Expected Value - Healthcare sector 4% attack rate; 17-day average downtime; $15M-$58M cost per incident including HIPAA penalties
top_10_risks_ranked.notes: Low probability but catastrophic impact; partially insured via cyber policy $5M-$10M limits
top_10_risks_ranked.mitigation: Enhanced cybersecurity controls (EDR/XDR, MFA), incident response plan, cyber insurance $10M coverage, offline backups

findings.summary: March 2025 survey critical; 2 prior immediate jeopardy citations; 30-40% probability of provider agreement termination
Orange County and other facilities at risk of repeat immediate jeopardy → DPNA 6-12 months
Orange County $990K + Desert Sun $540K = $1.53M already lost
Orange County $95K + Desert Sun $42K civil monetary penalties already paid
Midpoint $214K-$1.07M range for repeat deficiencies across portfolio
Federal rule repealed December 2025; cost avoidance $4.3M annually + $344K-$800K recruitment (positive for buyer)
DOJ intervention expected Q1-Q2 2025; settlement $8M-$15M for therapy upcoding, PDPM gaming
IRO audits, annual reports, compliance training, arrangements review; $11M-$16M over 5 years
Legal fees $500K-$800K covered by D&O duty to defend
Document production, employee interviews; $200K-$500K (may be covered by D&O investigation sublimit)
$11M annual wage/benefit increases required to reduce 67% nursing turnover; net cost $7.5M after savings
290 employees × 60 days back pay if no notice; $3.75M-$4.5M uninsured (EPLI excludes statutory penalties)
$21/hour minimum effective June 1, 2025; 144 CNAs below requirement; $1.2M annual cost ongoing
3 California facilities; missed break allegations; $600K-$1.2M settlement range
$200K-$500K settlement; covered by EPLI (only deductible $50K-$100K uninsured)
Dr. Johnson $180K (90th percentile) with minimal duties; strengthens Martinez kickback allegations
$600K-$2.4M assignment fees + $4.5M-$6M temporary agency risk if terminations
Pharmacy, food service, medical supplies; 90-95% consent success rate; minimal risk
Dr. Johnson overpayment vs. FMV $150K-$165K; $15K-$30K annual excess

findings.finding: D&O Coverage Gap for FCA Settlement
findings.summary: 40-60% probability D&O excludes fraud-based claims; $4.8M-$10.5M uninsured
Professional liability excludes regulatory fines and lost revenue; $1.67M FY2024 + future risk
EPLI excludes statutory penalties; $3.75M-$4.5M if no 60-day notice (duplicates Employment category but shows insurance gap)

findings_by_domain.notes: Overlaps with other categories; shows insurance coverage gaps rather than additive exposure

findings.summary: Buyer receives $5M-$5.25M annual tax savings from stepped-up basis depreciation/goodwill amortization
If Silver Oak portfolio >3,050 FTEs aggregated, $454K annual penalty if fail to offer MEC to 95%

findings_by_domain.notes: Negative values represent benefits (tax savings) that reduce net risk exposure

findings.summary: 4% annual attack rate × $15M-$58M per incident cost = $3.6M expected value; cyber insurance $5M-$10M partial coverage
HIPAA + CA CPRA + AZ + NV penalties for 1,485 residents; $2.0M-$6.7M range
12-facility portfolio; $1.2M-$2.2M exposure over 3 years; 40% probability OCR enforcement
Unknown breaches 2019-2024; $1.0M-$4.5M HIPAA Tier 2-3 penalties if discovered post-closing

correlation_adjustments.description: Adjustments for correlated risks to avoid double-counting exposures with shared root causes

pairs_adjusted.adjustment_rationale: WARN Act triggered by Orange County closure; same root cause (SFF termination); count WARN at 15% probability instead of 35% to avoid double-counting
Medical director FMV violations strengthen FCA case but don't create separate settlement; kickback adds to same settlement amount; reduce kickback contribution by 50%
D&O gap is subset of FCA settlement exposure; not additive; insurance gap already reflected in 'uninsured exposure' category
pairs_adjusted.notes: Captured in separate insurance category; no further adjustment needed

pairs_adjusted.adjustment_rationale: Historical and future DPNA partially correlated (same facilities) but different time periods; reduce future risk slightly
SB 525 wage increases overlap with retention investment wage component; reduce duplication

ONE_TIME_exposures.description: Single events or near-term exposures requiring no discounting

MULTI_YEAR_exposures.description: Phased programs with defined end dates; discounted at 8% rate

PERPETUAL_exposures.description: Recurring annual costs with no end date; NPV = Annual ÷ 8%
PERPETUAL_exposures.notes: Perpetual exposures represent ongoing operational costs; not appropriate for escrow but factor into purchase price/EBITDA adjustments

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on: (1) industry precedent/benchmark data, (2) severity of underlying facts, (3) regulatory enforcement patterns, (4) expert judgment where empirical data limited
quantification_methodology.time_profile_classification: ONE_TIME (face value), MULTI_YEAR (DCF 8% discount), PERPETUAL (NPV = Annual ÷ 8%)
quantification_methodology.correlation_adjustments: Applied to 5 correlated pairs to avoid double-counting shared root causes
quantification_methodology.exclusions: Sale-leaseback EBITDA impact ($7M-$11M annual) excluded as elective strategic decision, not risk exposure; CMS staffing minimums excluded as repealed regulation (cost avoidance, not liability)

critical_findings: Orange County SFF Termination Risk ($24.6M, 35% probability)
high_findings: Corporate Integrity Agreement ($13.5M over 5 years, 50% probability)

immediate_pre_closing.action: Orange County Mock Survey + Interim Management
immediate_pre_closing.rationale: Mitigate $24.6M CRITICAL exposure; must complete before March 2025 survey
Secure assignment consents; negotiate fee waivers with contract extensions

immediate_pre_closing.action: Tender FCA Claim to D&O Insurer
immediate_pre_closing.rationale: Trigger duty to defend; preserve coverage even if partial exclusion
Mandatory compliance; avoid class action exposure + statutory violations

post_closing_months_1_6.rationale: Stabilize 67% nursing turnover; required for operational sustainability
IRO engagement, compliance software, training programs for 5-year CIA
Mitigate $36M ransomware exposure; industry standard controls

ongoing_monitoring.action: Monthly Orange County Quality Metrics Dashboard
ongoing_monitoring.rationale: Early warning system for SFF risk; track deficiency trends, staffing PPD, quality measures
Ensure all 12 medical directors maintain FMV compliance; document hours, duties, referral patterns
OCR enforcement risk mitigation; breach notification readiness, BAA compliance

go_no_go_factors.condition: Mock survey + interim management deployed 60 days pre-closing; purchase agreement includes $12M escrow for SFF termination risk
DOJ intervention decision expected Q1-Q2 2025; closing can proceed with $10M escrow + D&O tender; monitor for settlement timing
$11M annual investment required; reduces EBITDA $52M → $44.5M net; purchase price adjusted $7.3M

deal_impact_assessment.deal_recommendation: PROCEED with: (1) $28M escrow (24-month), (2) $15M purchase price reduction, (3) Orange County mock survey pre-closing, (4) FCA D&O tender immediate, (5) R&W insurance for tail CIA costs Years 3-5. Total quantified exposure $47.9M manageable with proper structuring.
key_sensitivities: Orange County March 2025 survey outcome (35% probability of $24.6M loss)
DOJ intervention on Martinez FCA (60% probability affects settlement amount $8M-$15M)
D&O insurer FCA coverage decision (50% probability of $4.8M-$10.5M uninsured gap)

validation_notes.double_counting_eliminated: Applied correlation adjustments for 5 overlapping exposure pairs totaling $3.32M reduction
validation_notes.time_value_adjustments: Applied DCF/NPV to MULTI_YEAR and PERPETUAL exposures; ONE_TIME at face value
validation_notes.probability_calibration: All probabilities based on documented methodology in source reports; validated against industry benchmarks where available
validation_notes.ranges_to_midpoint: Used midpoint methodology for all ranges (e.g., $8M-$15M → $11.5M); tracked P10/P50/P90 distribution separately
validation_notes.exclusions_documented: Excluded sale-leaseback as elective decision (not risk), CMS staffing minimums as repealed (cost avoidance)
